column1: Maple Shade Township operates within the Faulkner Act (formally known as the Optional Municipal Charter Law) under the Council-Manager (Plan E) form of municipal government
column2: implemented based on the recommendations of a Charter Study Commission as of January 1
column3: 1975. The township is one of 42 of 565 municipalities statewide that use this form of government. The governing body is comprised of a five-member Township Council
column4: whose memebrs are elected at-large in partisan elections to serve four-year terms of office on a staggered basis
column5: with either two or three seats up for election in even-numbered years as part of the November general election. At a reorganization meeting held during the first week of January after each election
column6: the Council selects one of its members to serve as Mayor and another as Deputy Mayor.As of 2020
column7: members of the Maple Shade Township Council are Mayor Claire B. Volpe (D
column8: term on committee and as mayor ends December 31
column11: term on committee and as deputy mayor ends 2020)

column1: The Maple Shade School District serves public school students in kindergarten through twelfth grade. As of the 2018–19 school year
column5: 224 students and 183.1 classroom teachers (on an FTE basis)
column6: for a student–teacher ratio of 12.1:1. Schools in the district (with 2018–19 enrollment data from the National Center for Education Statistics) are

column1: Howard R. Yocum Elementary School with 556 students in grades K to 2
Maude M. Wilkins Elementary School with 406 students in grades 3-4
Ralph J. Steinhauer Elementary School with 369 students in grades 5-6 and
Maple Shade High School with 861 students in grades 7-12.Students from Maple Shade Township
column2: and from all of Burlington County
column3: are eligible to attend the Burlington County Institute of Technology
column4: a countywide public school district that serves the vocational and technical education needs of students at the high school and post-secondary level at its campuses in Medford and Westampton Township.
